summary: mark clattenburg will take charge of the manchester derby on sunday . the english referee sent off vincent kompany for belgium against israel . tyler blackcett and luke shaw have also been sent off for united . clattenburg will be joined by assistants simon beck and jake collin . jonathan moss will serve as the fourth official at old trafford .

explain: Referee Mark Clattenburg will be in charge of the highly anticipated Manchester derby between Manchester United and Manchester City. This follows his earlier experience with sending off Vincent Kompany for Belgium against Israel. Clattenburg will have assistants Simon Beck and Jake Collin, and Jonathan Moss as the fourth official at Old Trafford.

In this context, there are discussions regarding the accusation that Mark Clattenburg might show favor to Manchester United, particularly with regard to his decision-making during the match. The question arises due to his earlier sent off of Manchester United's players (Vincent Kompany and Tyler Blackett) and the absence of such calls to the opposition (believed to be Manchester City) in the described match situation.
Clattenburg is among the top referees in the Premier League, sharing the spotlight with Michael Oliver.
